narratives.narrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader
narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death. The question is, why the desperation to keep the war going?
narratives.reasoning: This quote shifts blame for the prolongation of the war and resulting deaths onto Western media and implied Western actions, rather than attributing responsibility to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

narratives.evidence_quote: amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing …for me …,a poor western subject.. I have NEVER agreed with you..in fact you have NEVER asked me my thoughts ….oh sorry I was / am just your cannon fodder …I do not count…
narratives.reasoning: This quote criticizes Western governments and policies, portraying them as dismissive of their citizens and manipulative, which aligns with discrediting the West.

narratives.evidence_quote: amerikans are the greatest pigs on the planet…and that is in the most derogitive term you can imagine.. absolute pigs
narratives.reasoning: The language used here is explicitly derogatory and aims to undermine the moral character and legitimacy of Americans and, by extension, Western nations.

narratives.evidence_quote: they are the enemy of one sort or the other.. time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name
narratives.reasoning: This quote criticizes Western politicians and implies systemic failure in Western governance, further discrediting Western diplomacy and leadership.

narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death... information that you are missing from the corporation propaganda western media
narratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly questions the reliability and integrity of Western media, labeling it as propaganda and implying it is deliberately misleading the public.

narratives.narrative_name: URW: Negative Consequences for the West
narratives.evidence_quote: time to stop caring about the people that do not care..they are the enemy of one sort or the other.. time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name
narratives.reasoning: This quote suggests that Western populations will face negative consequences due to the actions of their leaders, implying a form of retribution or backlash.

narratives.evidence_quote: Will they resort to nuclear weapons to even out the war?... lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly
narratives.reasoning: This quote evokes fear by speculating about the use of nuclear weapons and the catastrophic consequences of a full-scale nuclear war, amplifying anxiety about the conflict's escalation.

narratives.evidence_quote: for the west it’s always been the soviet (RUSSIAN) that has ALWAYS been the boogie man..when in fact they were SELDOM a threat
narratives.reasoning: This quote portrays Russia as a historical victim of Western fearmongering and misrepresentation, suggesting that Russia has been unfairly targeted and mischaracterized.

While not directly praising Russia, this quote implicitly praises Scott Ritter, who is presented as a truthful commentator on Russia's position, indirectly supporting a positive view of Russia's actions.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: The West are the aggressors
subnarratives.evidence_quote: for the west it’s always been the soviet (RUSSIAN) that has ALWAYS been the boogie man..when in fact they were SELDOM a threat.. amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing …for me …,a poor western subject.. I have NEVER agreed with you..in fact you have NEVER asked me my thoughts ….oh sorry I was / am just your cannon fodder …I do not count…
subnarratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly shifts blame for the conflict onto the West, portraying Russia as a victim of Western exaggeration and aggression. It aligns with the subnarrative that the West, not Russia, is the true aggressor in the war.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: Other

Scott Ritter ..good topics ..talking the truth..yes but where is what he says getting us …seems nowhere ..lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly and no more of month after month of promises from Trump or threats from the east….POOF..it’s all over …thanks mostly to un-elected bureaucrats in all “western countries” they are proving the worst of the worst of humanity

It emphasizes Western culpability in a broader, more hyperbolic manner, warranting the inclusion of 'Other'.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: Other
subnarratives.evidence_quote: I am sure Scott will have a safe place he can go .. he talks the most sense ….pity he cannot all but talk about it….most of the rest of the “un Nuclear war countries” will have to survive the horrors left behind of Russia China`Britain (lots of europe) amerika canada australia NZ.. NOBODY asked their populations ..we are just told…but we deserve EVERYTHING we get
subnarratives.reasoning: This quote further reinforces the parent narrative by implying that Western populations are complicit in the actions of their governments and deserve the consequences, while absolving Russia of primary responsibility.
